Reviews.Title: “Basic and decent botel outside the centre of LA”
Reviews.Author: NaRif2011
Reviews.Content: Summary: A decent, relatively cheap, and basic place to stay in LA. Location: In the Hollywood area, about 10 minutes (drive) from the Kodak Theatre, 15 minutes from the Griffiths Observatory and Universal Studios. We had a car so found it easy to get around, there are buses nearby, but cannkt comment on good / easy they are to use. The hotel is next to two hospitals so you can get ambulance noise, but it's not too bad. There are a couple of fast-food joints nearby which are walkable. Room: A decent size, with enough space for us and two suitcases. There is also a small fridge and a coffee maker. The bathroom is also a decent size. Note, there was no lift so we had to take our suitcases up the stairs... please bear this in mind when booking this motel. Cleanliness: Room and bathroom was nice and clean. The corridor / walkways are outdoor are a bit worn but fine, and still clean. Breakfast: There is a basic breakfast of fruits and cereal available at reception. Hot drinks available too. Internet: Free wireless is available... the connection is reliable and speedy. We used it for Skyping and uploading pictures and it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: coonkitty c
Reviews.Content: place is VERY noisy. They had some construction happening in the room right UNDERNEATH us which made it difficult to nap after a long 6 hour drive from the bay area. At night, it wasn't much better, being across the street from the hospital made for many sirens through the evening and let's not forget the drunk people returning to thier rooms at 2am, walls thin, could hear the TV in the next room over. Room was the smallest I have stayed in possibly ever! It did have a microwave and fridge, that was handy, but the television is old school, (guess I am spoiled and like the flat-screen look) Felt the room was hot too, we didnt use the a/c and we didn't sleep with the sheets either, too hot. The location is centralized to Hollywood, Los Feliz, which was good. I was able to do my morning run to Griffith Park and back without any problems. Different food within walking distance was a + Next time in LA, we will definately pay a little more to stay somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: DaleShaffer
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here. The rooms are very clean, wifi worked great, as did the a/c /heater. The neighborhood was very safe and is across the street from the Metro, which will take you up to Hollywood Blvd or to downtown LA. The staff was very helpful. Was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankG1955
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with useful microwave and fridge. Very good location next to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “I got what I paid for....”
Reviews.Author: dmross
Reviews.Content: When going to LA and trying to pick out a hotel/motel there is one really important thing to remember... take away a star to what ever rating is given to the hotel/motel. The hotel/motels seem to be a little worse here compared to other places I have been. A plus, I guess, about this place is that they have FREE parking. This is a total budget hotel, for people on a really TIGHT budget... Next time I wont be so cheap when going to LA. Our view was of the dumpsters and our room was next to the housekeeping room. Thankfully there is SO much to do in LA that we only needed to come to the Travelodge to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Transit friendly”
Reviews.Author: Midtowntimmy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for car-free traveling, great coffee shops and grocery store close.

Reviews.Title: “Are you visiting Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: tradlyn
Reviews.Content: This is a basic motel, good value for the price. The only drawback is the position. Without a car it is difficult to see the sites.. There are a few not very good restaurants within walking distance. If you. I suggest if you are a tourist to Hollywood you look for a nearer place. The breakfast in reasonable but the room is far too small.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but provided the basics for a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: grandmaDover_AR
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small. No place to put suitcases, so need to unload them and put them back in trunk of vehicle. If you are a light sleeper it may not be for you as there are 3 hospitals right across street so helicopters and ambulances are frequent. It was central located for our trip to all that we places we visited. Breakfast is very basic: Frosted Flakes, Raisin Bran, muffins, danish, toast, juice, and coffee. The rooms do have microwaves, and fridges. Beds were very nice and NO bed bugs. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price! I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Fabiana M
Reviews.Content: For the price, is a very good hotel! It's clean, the breakfast is good, the employess are very atetentive, always helping with informations. The parking helps a lot. The localization is great!There's TV, Mini-bar, wi-fi, calefactor and electric oven in rooms. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at the Travelodge International Inn in Anaheim so we didn't expect much here but it was actually very nice! Nicely remodeled rooms, clean. The only concern was the noise, our neighbors were very loud and kept smoking outside the room which was seeping into ours. Parking was limited, it was hard to find a spot sometimes. Other than that it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “I want to give this motel a decent rating, but can't - bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: tomatohead
Reviews.Content: I've stayed over three times in the last two years. It's location across the street from Children's Hospital means that it's the most convenient for our quarterly visits there. The free parking is convenient. Sadly, of the four times we've stayed, I've been bitten by something twice. One time, it was bedbugs for sure (telltale linear bites that are different from mosquitos and fleas). Some of the night managers are friendly and kind, but sadly, the some of the staff during the day are just too overworked.

Reviews.Title: “Take your business elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: JaseP1975
Reviews.Content: After a 14 hour flight I arrived to find the hotel without power so I was asked to come back in a couple of hours during which time the manager would be available and the hotel would be able to confirm my reservation.(Never mind the fact I had provided a printed copy of the confirmation email to them).When I returned it got to the point where I almost jumped the counter and throttled the manager due to his rudeness and general unwillingness to help.Do yourself a favour and go elsewhere,this place doesn't deserve your hard earned.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehebrewhoya
Reviews.Content: The 2-story, "strip mall" type hotel is not inviting, and this is a budget hotel, but prepare to be surprised... the rooms are clean, the staff pleasant, the parking free, and the location fantastic. Price is good (ask for the KP discount) and includes a simple breakfast (cereal, muffins/danish, bananas, tea/coffee). This was a convenient no-frills property for a business/solo traveler. Probably OK for family on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: CH_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to post a rather good review. The room is big, the bed comfortable. The fridge and microwave are a plus. The proximity of the subway station and express buses stops allow to travel easily in the city. But on the last night I had about 20 insect bites on my left arm. After looking around in the room I found several bed bugs! Look at the attached picture. This one has been seen on the wall of the room near the bed.

Reviews.Title: “A horroble Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hagen3000
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights and at 2nd night stroke a tree the cable and the whole Hotel got no electricity. No Information from the stuff, just the answer: you can check out. No cashback, no compensation. So, they mentioned that I have to search a New Hotel and pay maybe the difference. So, we stayed 54hrs without light, TV, Internet and heating in the room and the Owner cashed the full prize. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: TinaBull
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions weren't good but the rooms were nicer than expected. Big enough, comfortable bed, good wifi. Bargain for LA.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay , but horrible service thanks 2 SANJEEN OR BILL”
Reviews.Author: 0Alessa
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible, a gye named liked sanjeen mehta that i think that he have a nickname like bill or something like that, he treated me and my friend in a very disrespectful way, telling us we was making him wasting his time and told us( go to your room, look in your computer and then come down and tlak to me)..pnÃ±y because we was asking about a mistake they maded with my credit card .. a very rude person this guy!!then he sent another guy to our room to tell us that really happened,, i thing its a good place to stay,, but thhanks to bill or sanjeen mehta i had a bad experience hereee

Reviews.Title: “Average...room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: POLLITOS2010
Reviews.Content: Where to start with this one...we went to the west coast for the very first time late October, 2011. We visited Vegas, and then drove from there to Los Angeles, California, and spent 4 days here. After rigorous researching as always for hotel rooms, we decided to go with this one. The price is extremely descent and the location is Great! with this being said, the rooms are average, I am not a complainer, I am very flexible, but I do have these 4 points that bothered me: 1- THE NOISE!!! i have never slept in a more noisy hotel room before!!!! noises woke me up every single day!!!! there was people up super early in the morning hammering stuff, like working on construction or something! it was horrible! when it wasn't the noise of this, it was some other super loud noise, I don't know what's up with this place, but there had to be some loud noise waking us up super early in the morning every day and that did really set me off!! I have stayed at hotels right next to airports before and not even there the noise has been this horrible!!! 2- THE TUB CLOGGED: Ok, so we came back from sunset strip and decided to swing by the hotel room and change outfits and freshen up for a bit, I wanted to take a shower, and after a minute of two of being in the shower i noticed that the water was not draining away, the drain was clogged or something for some weird reason cause the day before we showered with no problem, but for some reason, the second day the tub clogged and it was disgusting to be standing in the tub trying to shower with all this dirty disgusting water stuck not draining out! UGH! i was sooo annoyed!!! the next morning we mentioned the incident to the guy in the reception, and they fixed it immediately! Kudos for that!! 3- THE "FREE PARKING"....Yes, it does have free parking, but their parking space is tiny!! and so it gets full soon and easily, and if that's the case your screwed! you gotta go around the block and try and find where to park next to some houses! it was a huge pain in the neck for us, as we went partying every night, and every night when we came back to the hotel at about 2 am or so, all the parking spaces were full, so we had to go around the block, cold, tired, and me still tipsy (he drove) and try to find parking. This same process happened EVERY DAY! pretty annoying and inconvenient! 4- SCARE OUTLETS: I have never stayed at a place with so little outlets!! are you kidding me!! we had to pretty much disconnect everything in that room to be able to free the outlets to connect all our crap! we almost had to even unplug the tv to be able to plug our laptop! it was pretty ridiculous, not a major situation, but if you are like us, who travel with lop top, and two digital cameras which batteries need to be recharged, and cellphones which need to be charge and blow drier and hair straightener, then you are in little of a pickle like us! I rather not write bad reviews if i can help it, but I had to mention these things!...now, with all the bad things already mentioned, the place was very clean, they have a super comfortable bed I think california king cause the thing was HUGE!, We inspected for bedbugs and found none, the whole time we were there we didn't find any trace of them, and it's been already 2 weeks since we came back home and apparently we didn't bring any unwanted visitors with us, so I think it is safe to say the place is free of bedbugs, or well, at least the room we stayed at. They also offer: Free breakfast, Free Internet, Excellent location and Excellent room service! I AM DEF. STAYING HERE AGAIN IF I EVER GO BACK TO L.A. Like I said, the place is over all nice, and a great value for the price, again, they just have room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Our LA Trip”
Reviews.Author: MarieB11
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean place to lay your head and get a free good breakfast than this is the place to stay. It is in a great location if you want to go to Universal Studios (15 min drive) or a few minutes on the metro line which is just acroos the road .A $ 5 dollar ticket for use all day that can also be used on metro buses. There is a bus stop close by. Griffith Park Observatory (10 min drive) free shuttle at weekends. Chinese theatre also within easy reach on the metro. Long Beach again easily accesible by the metro approx 1 hour with frequent trains . So location is great how about the room and facilities? Clean bedsheets, clean toilet and shower. Mini fridge in room and coffee maker with microwave in room which is handy, also has a mini safe. We also had 2 bedrooms with ours. If you need absolute quiet through the night then this is not the place for you as you will hear the ambulance through the night due to the 2 hospitals opposite. The pool outside although not heated is clean and we enjoyed the usage . The breakfast was ideal for us as we wanted cereal, toast, tea and orange juice.The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Bill he went out of his way to help us with city trips and transportation As long as your expectations are in line with your budget you will not be disappointed. There are many food places within walking distance amd pizza and Indian food can be delivered to your room with flyers picked up in reception. We would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jwfhunts
Reviews.Content: For a reasonably priced, clean and comfortable room which is convenient for public transport- this property is spot on. Plenty of hot water and towels are changed daily. A light breakfast is served daily - basic but adequate. When the motel is full, arriving late at night may cause difficulty in finding a parking space. Rooms 145 and 284, overlook a carpark and noise can be heard from it. Would certainly stay here again - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain LA Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyMcLovin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2011 whilst we did our road trip of California and Las Vegas. Booked through Expedia as is was only Â£37 per night and had the added bonus of free parking. I recalled from my last trip to LA that the valet parking set me back around $80 for the 4 nights stay at another hotel. On the plus side of this hotel it is very close to all major attractions and has many decent restaurants within walking distance. Staff are very helpful and freindly. Rooms are a decent size, clean and have a good shower. There is a small pool in the middle of the car park. Didn't use it but it looked ok. There was always somewhere to park and it was free. On the down side...it is very close to a major hospital so sirens can be heard at all times of night. There do seem to be alot of homeless people in the area but they do not bother or hassel you. The breakfast included is poor. Don't let it fool you that it's something special. There is a Starbucks etc. just across the road though. Overall for a hotel in the middle of LA you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: tas62675
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for three nights last week and we were happy with what we got for the price. We knew going into it that it would be a no frills motel that would serve as a place to sleep after long days of sight-seeing and a place for a nice hot shower. It is definitely nothing fancy and what we termed "bare bones" - a term that my 7 year old learned on the trip. But it was fine for us and our needs. We wanted to spend our money elsewhere. The location was good - it was a 1/2 block from a Metro stop so that was a plus. And it was an easy drive to Griffith Park - which is literally down the street and up the hill. We were not bothered by the sounds from the hospital across the street. The area isn't the greatest and I wouldn't have walked around at night, but further down the road toward the park you could tell the area was getting a little nicer and had trendier restaurants. The continental breakfast was nothing fancy, but it offered two kinds of cereal, fresh fruit, toast, prepackaged muffins, coffee and juice. What impressed me was that there was a worker who's one and only job was refilling the breakfast items. My experience has been that everything is put out early and if you arrive later in the morning chances are you won't get anything. This wasn't the case, as the worker constantly restocked everything, even right up until the very end. We also enjoyed the free internet service available in the lobby. Granted only 10 minutes were free, but that's all we needed to check directions or print out tickets. We did have to pay $1.00 per print out, which I thought was a bit much. As for cons, our beds didn't have blankets on them when we arrived, even though it was after the check-in time and about 5:00 p.m. Housecleaning did come by with fresh blankets before I had a chance to call the desk, though, so that was nice. Otherwise the showers were hot, we enjoyed the fridge and the microwave available to us. The parking lot did get crowded at night, but that comes with staying over the weekend. One disappointment was that the pool was empty. It had been advertised I thought as a heated pool and we had been hoping to use it. But we got a great price on the room, had a free breakfast and it was in a good location so we couldn't complain. The front desk staff were also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and breakfast, but exterior factors let it down.”
Reviews.Author: jk80
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week at beginning of October based on price, good location, and mostly positive reviews. The room was fine, a little small, but fine TV, reasonable bed, bathroom and shower fine. Also had fridge. safe and microwave. Breakfast also absolutely fine, ie what I'd expect for the price, fruit, cereals, toast, coffee, pastries, served for a decent length of time. Service also fine, when we arrived we were offered advice on where to go etc, plus when we complained about noisy people outside our room late one night, the night clerk promptly came up and asked them to keep it down, so all fine. The main issues were to do with the location, and the general sorts of problems you get with hotels of this design. We're always struck by how quickly American streets can go from nice to dodgy in a very small distance and this neighbour hood is no different. Hotel premises, fine and well lit, but as soon as you walk out you've got homeless people all over the place, Thai "massage" etc, but then also other nice hotels and reasonable premises too. It's not really Travelodge's fault, but we weren't often keen on going for a stroll around in the evening. That said, there are a number of places to eat nearby, mostly junk though. The second problem is to do with the motel style design of the hotel, ie all of the room's doors opening to a central, open area. It meant that the noise of sirens from the nearby hospital, general car noise, and the noise of some inconsiderate fellow guests often disturbed us, especially in the evenings. None of this would have been so bad if not for the two-inch gap under our door! Even after trying to block it with coats, noise and often, smoke, from outside would come in, and this wasn't terribly pleasant. Again, not 100% the hotel's fault, but not something you'd get with interior corridors and a better door. I don't know if all of the doors had this gap. That said, I'd still recommend the place as it was economical, in a very useful location for getting to things by car or Metro, and the breakfasts were fine. Also wifi worked with the minimum of fuss, no issues there.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel Safe”
Reviews.Author: RadTechCrys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided on this place when we visited Universal Studios for a day. We also wanted to tour around the Hollywood/Beverly Hills area while we were there. This place was the most reasonable priced around the places we wanted to go to. When we got there, the front desk clerk, Bill, was very nice and helpful in recommending a bus tour for us. The tour turned out to disappoint our expectations but that's a whole other story. We checked on our garmin for nearby places to eat after we got settled in. We walked a couple blocks to a nearby pizza joint. We passed by countless of homeless people on our way and I felt very uncomfortable. The parking lot on the property was poorly lit at night. The breakfast selection was mediocre at best, but it did its job in fueling us up for the long day we had ahead of us. Checkout process was a bit slow but the front desk clerk were friendly so I didn't squabble about that. The beds were not that comfy. The water pressure in the shower wasn't the greatest either. Bottom line, you get what you pay for. If convenience is all you're after, then stay here. I won't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Nim P
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean place to lay your head and get a free breakfast than this is the place to stay. It is in a great location if you want to go to Universal Studios (15 min drive) Griffith Park Observatory (10 min drive). So location is great how about the room and facilities? Clean, bedsheets, clean toilet and shower. Mini fridge in room and coffee maker with microwave in room which is handy, also has a mini safe. If you need absolute quiet through the night then this is not the place for you as you will hear the ambulance through the night due to the 2 hospitals opposite. We didnt use the pool outside so cant comment on that. The breakfast was ideal for us as we wanted cereal, toast, tea and orange juice. We always found parking in the car park and the staff were very friendly and helpful. As long as your expectations are in line with your budget you will not be disappointed. We had a car and there are many food places within walking distance we also had pizza and Indian food delivered to our room with flyers picked up in reception. Washing machine didn't work when we used it but reception happily refunded our money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Seano Rese Q
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few nights after first flying into LA from Australia. For the price we paid, the room was very clean and the hotel's in a relatively convenient location in East Hollywood. We had a car which made it a quick 5 minute drive to the main attractions on Hollywood Boulevard but it's also close to a Metro station. Another close by attraction's Griffith Park which is definitely worth the drive to. Breakfast only included a limited selection and breakfast room was crowded so we ate at the local McDonalds a few minutes down the road. Would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “No-frills, but safe and economical choice in East Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Kenat323
Reviews.Content: When I need to hang by hat for a brief stop in LA on short notice, I'll often choose the Travel Lodge on Vermont. It offers a very basic motel room, but is one of the few places this far east that is a "normal" motel. It certainly has its flaws--arrive back past 11pm and you'll have to park wherever you can find on their undersized lot--usually including no parking zones. No elevator and few stairways mean that lugging bags upstairs is a necessary chore. They also cut off breakfast way too early on weekends. But the breakfast is free and relatively nutritious (i.e., not just a prepackaged sugary danish as in similar motels). Coffee is horrible--next time I'll bring my own. I'm from LA, so I don't find the neighborhood as sketchy as some others do. It is down the block from some large hospital complexes, so not particularly isolated. It is also within an easy walk of great LA restaurant/lounges like the Dresden (see the movie "Swingers" if you don't know it.) So you can stay out late without worrying about driving--a rare LA treat. Between Vermont Ave. and downtown LA is a no-man's land for clean, safe, economical lodging, so this place is great if you want to be near Hollywood, downtown, Silver Lake. Los Feliz or the other nearby areas but don't want to pay downtown or central Hollywood prices. There is a charm-free pool in the middle of the parking lot but I've never used it. It seems most guests are Europeans--I guess they recognize a bargain when they find one.

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel but fine as a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: EvilHomerBoo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was cheap and central. I was hoping to be able to walk to tourist areas of Hollywood Boulevard and Sunset Boulevard but, being naive, I didn't quite grasp the scale of things in the USA! It was actually over 3 miles to the main attractions like the walk of fame etc so a bit far to walk for us, but fine to drive. The area was a bit scary especially at night (run down and some scary looking locals!) so we didn't leave the hotel in the evening as there were no bars or restaurants other than fast food within walking distance (we wanted to drink and budget too small to pay for cabs). The hotel has the appearance of a motel, in that each room has it's own front door. Rooms are well equipped including a fridge and microwave! Decor a bit old fashioned but clean. Maid service daily, bathroom fine. The breakfast was included as was cereal, muffins and toast. Concierge man was nice - opened my bottle of wine as I didn't have an opener. There is a small pool but I didn't use it when we were there. Wouldn't stay again but only because of the area and didn't really like LA but I would recommend it to someone who just wanted somewhere cheap and central to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Big bed,but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: RazzyRazzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Travelodge. Had no bites by bed bugs. Got a big room with a view over the parking lot. Big and comfortable bed. The door to our room was right next to the stairs, so we could hear other guest dragging their suitcases down the stairs, for early checkout. Took us at least 1 hour to walk to the walk of fame. We thought it was a shorter walk, so we didn't take the car, but we should have!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location”
Reviews.Author: CTPN
Reviews.Content: This motel is very well-located and is excellent value. The staff were very friendly. Free parking and wifi worked well. Breakfast was basic but coffee was much too weak. There are a couple of small shops and a Metro station within easy walking distance. The pool is not great because it's in the middle of the parking lot. I would recommend the hotel for anyone, including families, on a tight budget. Our son had a bad case of bedbugs that appeared a couple days after leaving (when we were in SF) and while we cannot say for sure where they came from, it's possible that they were picked up at this motel. (I feel bad about having to add this last caveat, and I would still highly recommend this motel. Please look for signs and wash your clothes if you find any evidence of bites!)

Reviews.Title: “From a 4 to a 1 in one quick bite (or actually dozens of bites)”
Reviews.Author: FreshGinger
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a trip to LA and San Francisco. Prior to leaving for the trip my travel companion and I were really looking forward to staying at the Travelodge Vermont/Sunset based on the reviews and comments posted online. The hotel started out great, check in was easy, breakfast and wi-fi were free, but by the 2nd day of our stay I was covered in mysterious, itchy, red bites, which I initially assumed was an allergic reaction to something I had eaten since my companion was bite free. Throughout the rest of my stay more and more bites continued to develop and by our last day in LA my friend was also covered in itchy, red bites as well. Since we were both covered in bites, we did a bit of research and discovered that we'd been bitten by BEDBUGS! This put a damper on the rest of our trip, as we were concerned that we would transfer the bugs along with us to San Fran - not to mention the crazy itching that plagued us the rest of our trip and still is now that we're at home. I would have given this hotel a 4, for overall service, location and having good basic amenities, but being itchy and feeling gross and bitten for a week+ after killed my stay and the rest of my trip. If you want a basic, cheap hotel take your chances staying here, because clearly you may have a nasty surprise lurking in the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Maxconti
Reviews.Content: Strategic position, clean and large full-equipped rooms, parking, swimming pool, internet workstation freely available, cheap rates. What do you want more?

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!! GREAT LOCATION!! WOULD RETURN”
Reviews.Author: ladream
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel to be suprised about this hotel i thought it would have been very dated, but it looks like it has been refurbished, this is not a 5 star hotel by all means but it is a very good travelodge. I didnt go in the pool but the colour of it made me think twice about going in. This location is great to travel around the whole of Los Angeles. Rooms clean, Staff friendly and you get a complementary breakfast. If this is your first time in la this will be a great hotel for location. I will be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bubble771
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early after an early morning flight. Exhausted, we wanted chance to sit down and catch our breath before heading out to explore. Despite turning up to the hotel 3 hours prior to the check in time, they were able to provide us with a room. The room was spotlessly clean, save for a dirty flannel in the bathroom - but the less said about that the better. With that sole exception, I would struggle to fault our stay here. The staff were helpful, and yes as someone else remarked they did try to sell certain tours to us, but saying no was easy enough. Breakfast is best carried back to the room as the lobby area where it is served is a little small, but the selection of cereals, toast and tea and coffee suited us fine nonetheless. It is also complimentary, which is more than can be said for some much more expensive hotels. Free internet is also a bonus. The hotel is ideally located a short walk from a red line metro station which for $6.00 a day you can use to access pretty much all the attractions in the area - we were there for 4 days and didn't run out of things to do. Griffith Observatory is walking distance but a bit of a hike! The view of the Los Angeles basin from the top and the Hollywood sign makes it more than worth the effort. The only other thing was that it took them a while to cancel the authorization of deposit on my credit card despite saying it would be done on check out (I knew this as it was the only exact $50 I had spent). However, aside from some noisy kids outside on the first night, this was a pleasant stay at a fairly basic but perfectly adequate, clean and friendly hotel. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: staarz10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay, location is pretty central with good access to Metro. Clean / safe surroundings, could easily walk out at night. Basic free breakfast provided by hotel is also good & helps save when travelling on a budget. Staff are helpful & friendly - will definitely recommend to other travellers !

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubblwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights on the first part of our trip to LA,Vegas and San Francisco. As we had only paid $35 per night we were not expecting much and were surprised when we arrived to find the room was large, very clean and exactly what we needed. As we were spending every day of our 4 days in LA sightseeing we only needed a place to lay our heads and this hotel certainly did the job for us. It is located about a two minute walk from the metro station which is on the Red Line and will take you to all the tourist spots ie Universal and Walk of Fame. The area is not the greatest as many tramps seem to have set up home there but to be honest they do not hassle you if you quietly walk past them. There are not many places to eat in this area, however we did find a lovely Mexican about a 10 min walk from the hotel (come out of the hotel turn left then right at the traffic lights-walk for about 10-mins and its on your left Breakfast at the hotel is also very very basic but OK (coffee and muffins, fruit) This hotel is not The Ritz, however if you are looking for a basic, clean cheap place to stay whilst sightseeing in LA I would recommened it

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: wordmongerer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with a bus stop outside and a ninute and a half walk to the subway station which will get you around the city for only $1.50 each way. The staff were very friendly and helpful and can arrange for any trips you might want to do from sightseeing to theme parks with arrangements in place to have you collected from the hotel. Rooms were of a decent size and were clean and comfortable. The rooms had a fridge, microwave, coffee machine and a good selection of TV channels. There was also free parking and free (though patchy) wifi. The hotel is a pretty good base to get around from and I felt safe at night here as its pretty isolated. Breakfast was a chore as the breakfast toom was tiny, so I recommend fetching your breakfast up to your room instead. There are a few shops nearby and a few fast food places to eat as well as a Wendys almost next door for either a burger or a salad. You're also just around the corner from a massive Scientology building which needs to be seen. There was a children's hospital opposite but we had no issues of noise during our stay. The only noisy thing was the air conditioner in our oom. Not a spot for the romantic traveller but a great stop for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “A good affordable base for LA”
Reviews.Author: sasha079
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our second night in LA, yes it is an older style motel, but it was good value. The beds were comfortable, the breakfast at reception was cereal and coffee etc, not many tables, but we just took the food back to our room and ate it there. Across the other side of Sunset is a shopping centre with a large chemist and a supermarket. We found this supermarket to be the cheapest supermarket in our whole trip. The deli was excellent and they had good cheap priced fruit. We stayed here to be close to Universal Studios which was a 10 minute drive in the morning. This was a good place to stay and not far from all the Hollywood stuff you want to see. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, friendly honest staff.”
Reviews.Author: mtwindow
Reviews.Content: The travelodge is perfectly located at the edge of the Los Feliz village. Out of the tourist zone, close to great restaurants and Griffith Park. The room was quiet, clean and plenty of free parking. For around $70/ night it suited my needs perfectly. All the staff were courteous and helpful and each room had good security with an in room safe for valuables. It isn't super modern or luxurious but very functional with free local calls, voicemail and wireless Internet. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueenuk
Reviews.Content: The place is a little dated, but the rooms are clean and the staff very helpful at the front desk. The metro red line is almost opposite the hotel, which is very convenient. Our room had a fridge, microwave and topped up the toiletries daily. There was no kettle, only a coffee maker that took an age to boil water which was a bit annoying. As a cheap, basic place to stay in LA I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Bextraveler
Reviews.Content: When I checked in to this motel, they asked for a $50 deposit. I am Ok with this as most places have asked for it. But most places will also accept a cash deposit. They refused here. I traveled to America on a UK credit card, so paying deposits also cost me a conversion fee, even though the $50 was returned at the end of the visit. This is the only place that refused a cash deposit. The room was what we expected. We stayed three nights and were given two very small bars of soap for three of us! And the cleaners removed the soap we had brought with us, without providing any more! So definitely could do with providing a bit more soap, especially if the old soap is removed! Our bath/shower drain was completely blocked, so dont want to think about what our feet were sitting in when showering. Toilet seat was broken. And we arrived to a blocked toilet, which I heard others complaining about also, but which was fixed within 5 minutes of us reporting it and did not block again. Oh and we were downstairs, can hear everything going on above us - TV, walking around etc The staff tried very hard to push a particular LA tour on us. We decided not to use it, and instead asked about public transport and they would not tell us anything. Extremely unhelpful in that area. The metro station is just up the road but they wouldn't tell us anything about it. Getting to the beaches is difficult. We tried the buses, took a VERY long time, public transport is not great in LA. But the room was clean, and the parking is free. There is a pool but wasn't quite warm enough for us to try it out. They have a computer in the lobby, but after an initial 10 minute free usage, you pay $3 per minute!!! So we definitely did not use that and found it a ridiculous price. A couple of blocks away on Hollywood Blvd, we found a BEAUTIFUL eating place, called The Boiling Shrimp. Highly recommend eating there, I ate there once every day we stayed! Delicious! Overall we might stay again, but might also look at staying somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Clean”
Reviews.Author: graingern
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and room was clean and tidy. Standard room we booked had queen bed, en-suite, fridge, t.v and microwave. We had a room on the ground floor now we did hear people walking around upstairs so if thats a problem for you maybe try a room on the upper level. The room was cleaned when we required you can have it cleaned daily if you so wish. The breakfast was cereal, juice, toast, tea/coffee, pastries and bananas. Breakfast seating area was a little cramped but there are trays in your room if you want to bring the food down to your room. There was a guy there overlooking the breakfast and would not let us close the door to the breakfast area as there was a cold breeze coming in. He said it was a business and it had to be kept open. I think he forgot that we were the business and would like to eat our breakfast in comfort. In the end we just brought our food to the room for the rest of the week as we found it too cold to eat in the breakfast area. There is a metro station just 3mins walk away and a supermarket 5mins away. The hotel also has a pool which we didn't use but looked very clean and sun loungers and chairs to use. The hotel has free wi-fi and printing facilities but at a cost of $1 per page. If you head out of the hotel and turn right there is a staples center down about 10mins walk and pages are 11cents to print from usb. Also just beyond the staples center there is a Chinese takeaway on the corner with wonderful food at very good prices. The hotel is across the road from two hospitals there is some noise but its mostly during the day so its all good. I would highly recommend booking ahead as there is a lot of money to be saved by doing so. We booked our room through www.hotels.com and got the room for $50 per night while I heard one walk-in couple being charged $130 per night. The hotel also has free off street parking.

Reviews.Title: “they are the most honest staff ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgueiros
Reviews.Content: It's very close to everything, there's a metro station really close to it. It's just off Sunset Blvd, where you can find anything you need and just a short drive/ride to the heart of LA. We accidentally left the safe open when we left for the day, and when we got back, everything was there, untouched. So I give the staff all stars they deserve!!! We are still traveling, and are planning to go back ti LA and stay there for 2 more nights!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel , good staff, ok to stay”
Reviews.Author: Horizon080
Reviews.Content: rooms are good , big enough compare to LA standard. manager and counter staff are friendly. location is just near to metro station but far from market . no proper grocery shop or eating joint near by hollywood shopping area and clubs are far hotel is located in bussiness area so it seems dead once offices close Breakfast is bad..nothing other than slice of bread so dont opt from that if you can get better discount in room price

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: Mia_Sh
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge is a very simple motel, with everything you need and no frills, for a great price. It has free parking, which saves a bunch. It offers a good and reasonable complimentary breakfast (cereal, cakes, bread, cream cheese, fruit, coffee/tea, juice). The corteous and helpful front desk staff is able to help with directions, and with tours. They even have a computer in the lobby, which you can use for free for a limited time (~10 minutes) or longer for a fee. The location is great, and although there was some street noise in the early morning, it was not so disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: GeoDB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice over a 3 week trip to the west coast and was thoroughly impressed both times. People rating this place need to keep in mind that it is a BUDGET hotel, and as a budget hotel, it excels. Great location, clean bedrooms, free wi-fi, an abundance of free toiletries, cable TV and a complimentary brekkie, I honestly couldn't fault the place. Definitely a great place to stay in LA with a car as they offer free parking; if travelling by public transport, there's eateries, bars and a grocery store and pharmacy near by. The staff are real friendly and are available to talk to you about the local attractions also.

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: rups123
Reviews.Content: I will say this in not a good hotel....the rooms are so small...Bathroom has no shower..very small...all get wet.. very old...not look like as u see in pics..Breakfast is normal..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: Frederique88
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at this hotel. the receptionists were really nice and they would let me call Paramount Pictures and Warner Brothers for tour dates and Ellen Degeneres Tickets. In the lobby they had breakfast. It is not much but hey, what do you expect for this price! they had fruit and juices en coffee which was fine. There is a starbucks 10 minutes away from the hotel. The room was good. A big tv, microwave, refrigorator (?), the beds were made up every day en the bathroom was nice. The only thing in the room that bothered me was that there was a lot of light coming trhough the curtains. but further, i loved this hotel. we were here for 2 weeks and it was good. we slept in other hotels for 3 nights and it was no problem. the location is great, though we had a own car so we didnt use any public transport. we could park our car in the parking everyday so that was perfect. Will deff come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: Rugbysw11
Reviews.Content: I was staying her car-less. The metro is just up the street, safe to walk to/from there at night. some places to eat nearby. The place was clean, quiet, and just what i needed. No fuss, no problems, easy check-in and check-out. Happy to call cabs etc. Exactly what you would expect from a Travelodge. I liked it and I will be back (already got my reservation made). Good internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Dutch-FIT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you visiting the city for a couple of days. The Travelodge is an ok hotel so don't expect 3 star quality. We arrived at 10 in the morning and normally hotels make a big deal out of early check ins, not this hotel. The front desk man is really friendly and we had to wait for 30 minutes to get our room. He offered us to have breakfast first and gaves us some information about city tours and theme parks. 30 minutes later we got our room. The room were we stayed had 2 separate bedrooms and a bathroom. We had a microwave and a refrigerator. Everything is simple, good enough to stay for a few nights. The breakfast is simple as well. There is some toast, fruit, cereal, pastries and coffee and juice. There is free wifi internet so perfect to keep family and friends posted on your adventures. The location is great. Near the hotel is the subway entrance and you can take several bus lines. Perfect location!! Overall it is a simple hotel and the staff is really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: steph3011
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was brilliant. You could get a bus pretty much anywhere from here, the Metro station was literally across the road and as it was the Red Line, you could get to all the tourist areas really quickly. I was quite badly bitten while I was away, but having no experience of bed bugs, don't know if that's what it was. In saying that, the bedding was clean and changed daily and there were fresh towels daily. The only problems I had with the maids, was the tv being left on the Spanish channels! There is free wifi in the rooms, and there is one computer in reception which you are allowed to use for 10mins. Fine if you need to check in online, but not much else. As said before, the breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, but it's handy if you need something quick for an early start. There are loads of places to eat nearby, there are a couple of supermarkets, a chemist and a handful of coffee shops. I wouldn't recommend the Ukranian restaurant immediately next door or the Chinese/Thai takeaway. Yes, the Children's Hospital is across the door, but I head a helicopter twice and sirens about half a dozen times. There is little to no noise during the night, so no way it could wake you up, unless you are the lightest of sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation if you have no car”
Reviews.Author: MartintravellerLondo
Reviews.Content: This is a Travelodge, so you know what to expect regarding room and amenities. The decoration is not great, but the rooms are clean and cleaned well daily, plus (unlike the UK) you get a fridge and microwave, so you can feed yourself with a quick snack from the local supermarket. There's a small free breakfast and coffee-making facilities in the room (no decaf) But it's the situation which mostly recommends it for a visit to LA without a car (though at reception they will probably tell you that you need a car to get around but that is LA). I always stay in this area because, although it dosen't look anything very special, there is a nice row of shops, cafÃ©s and restaurants higher up the street north of both Sunset and Hollywood Blvds(in Los Feliz village). There is a supermarket and a couple of fast food places between Sunset and Hollywood Bloulevards. So there's something to come back to in the evenings. For getting around buy a day pass from the ticket machines in the Red Line Metro station which is a couple of hundred yards away and use it for both buses and metro. The Rapid buses (numbers 700 and above) only stop at the main places and are as fast as using a car. You can easily visit: Universal Studios and UniversalCity (Red Line direct to Universal City) ;Hollywood (Red Line direct to Hollywood/Highland or Hollywood/Vine); downtown (Red Line to any of the stations - lunch time is best when the streets are full of workers on their break); Long Beach (Red Line to 7th/Metro Center) then Blue Line; Santa Monica (Bus 704 from Vermont/Santa Monica which is five minutes walk down Vermont from the hotel); Beverly Hills smart shoping, Westwood Village and UCLA (Red Line to Vermont/Wilshire) then bus 720 to the appropriate stop. From Westwood you can catch the 761 to the Getty Center; Glendale (for the Galleria and the amazing Americana Brand shopping centres) is 15 minutes away on the 180, 181 or 780 from Vermont/Hollywood Blvd. The same buses (the 780 is much faster) continue to Pasadena and stop at the Simon Norton Museum as well as the plesant downtown. You can even get to the hotel from the airport, even without a day pass or a TAP card. Catch the free airport G Line shuttle to Aviation station on the Green Line and buy a $1.50 single ride ticket to Vermont Avenue Station (three stops). Go out of the exit at the front of the train and catch the rapid 754 bus north on Vermont (frequent until mid-eveing, after which you'll have to use the slower 204). You'll need the exact $1.50 fare. Stay on it until the last stop (it takes 50 minutes to an hour) and you'll see the Travelodge on the left, just before the bus turns the corner from Vermont onto Sunset. It's a hundred yards or so to walk back. Much cheaper than an airport shuttle bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “GANG TERRITORY-NOT REALLY 'HOLLYWOOD'”
Reviews.Author: egnoir
Reviews.Content: Whoever writes positive reviews must work for the hotel... Check out LAPD gang map. http://www.lapdonline.org/gang_injunctions Click City Wide Map Tada! Travel Lodge Sunset and Vermont:) Plus I couldn't get towels and I had to argue to get a room key for all occupants. You would think the people working here would be happy to get normal business. Icky old smelly rooms. I posted generic photos...I just wanted to post this ASAP...nobody shoudl stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want to do things in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: xejorax
Reviews.Content: I really had a good experience at this hotel. The only complaint I have is that the comforter had some non-removable stains but the bed itself and bathroom were clean aside from that. There was not a lot of noise in the area even though it's in busy Hollywood. I was able to rest well. Restaurants around the area are good and the location is perfect and non-expensive for exploring the Hollywood area. I give this place a thumbs up if you are traveling in Hollywood and want a non-expensive place. Priceline.com gave me a good $55.00 a night deal for this hotel. My stay extended for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: daveywill
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with this motel The room was spotlessly clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was more than adequate considering it didn't cost anyting, and it couldn't have been easier to get around on the Metro and buses. The neighbourhood was also perfectly safe - might not have been the prettiest, but never felt dangerous. Just up he road is a really nice little strip of restaurants. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a stay without a car”
Reviews.Author: DunnieWunnie
Reviews.Content: The biggest misconception about sightseeing in LA is that one canâ€™t do without a car. I visited a lot of highlights in just two days using only public transport. - I paid about USD 92 per night for a room with 2 double beds. - The room was clean and spacious. - The air conditioning was a really noisy but I didn't need to turn it on. - Breakfast is basic but okay. You can have cereal with milk, some muffins, and fruit (bananas)! Coffee is like coffee should be, strong and black... - Hotel is 100 meters from the Metro Red Line (movie studios, Hollywood Blvd & Downtown), and from 302 and 2 bus line, which takes you to the Sunset Strip and UCLA. About 400 metres from 704 and 4 bus line, which takes you to Santa Monica beach. - There is a swimming pool which is clean and lovely to jump in after walking around for the entire day. - Environment is safe to walk around at night, no problems whatsoever. - 500 meters up north on Vermont Av there are lots of cool restaurants and bars, and a supermarket. Definitely would recommend this hotel. It is next to a hospital, but only noisy (helicopters and ambulances) during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a trash dump view”
Reviews.Author: Florian2010
Reviews.Content: I might have had bad luck with this motel, but during my stay, I had a room with a view to trash bags and other garbage dumped directly behind my room, on the motel's ground, apparently as part of the construction work. My kind request to the motel staff to have the trash bags removed had no result, and during the entire six days of my stay, the situation remained the same. I often woke up in the morning from construction noise. To add worse to bad, I once woke up at 4 a.m. in the morning from dribbling noise, realizing that some pipe had broken in the room above me, with water pouring down from the walls. (The night manager helped to stop the water, and gave me towels, but it was still inconvenient.) This motel is very conveniently located and offers good value, but I can't help saying that this was the worst hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Fab location. Good breakfast. Fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: vctorianne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in June. Loved it!! Location is brilliant. 5 mins from Hollywood (and the freeway). Also close to downtown. 2 mins from Griffith Observatory. Free parking. Free Wifi. Felt like our own little bungalow. Could park right outside our room. Had fridge, microwave, comfy bed. Nice clean bathroom. Lots of TV channels. Safe big enough for a laptop. And all of this was included in the price. Breakfast was one of the best free ones I've had. Two types of cereal, oatmeal, apples, bananas, two types of juice, tea, coffee, toast, pastries, muffins... lots and lots. Lots of restaurants around the local area. Pool was good enough. No one seemed to go in it (perhaps because it's in the car park). But it looked clean and there were lots of sunbeds etc around it. I would most definitely stay here if I ever visit LA again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Smell in rooms, alot of gangs/punks outside at night”
Reviews.Author: saracen2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my stag which I wanted to celebrate in LA., the hotel is really old, the rooms dont seem clean, there is just this shady feeling when in that hotel. Staff was horrible, as they would not give me a key after I lost mine after about an hour of arguing. Never staying here again, as soon as you leave your hotel at night, we were constantly approached by homeless people and others asking us for change. Its like a ghetto in the middle of hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: ashOceanside
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay in low price with all the facilitiesâ€¦â€¦.stay at Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, basic, friendly staff, helicopters fly a little low in this area”
Reviews.Author: rainbowren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travel lodge for nearly 2 wks with a break in between when we went to Vegas. Our first impression wasn't that flash - It was our first time in L.A - we arrived at night and honestly thought the surrounding area looked dodgy..but after a couple of days of getting out and about, it wasn't that bad at all. Yes the rooms are small - but they are clean - and you have the bonus of a fridge and microwave which comes in handy when your on a budget. The hotel provides breakfast from 6.30am - 9.30am and although it is basic (cereal, toast, coffee, juice, danish pastry/muffins), you can have as much as you want and it fills a gap before you start your day. There are only 3 small tables in the eating area but if they are full you can just take it back to your room. The staff are very friendly and helpful....There is a supermarket/petrol station and takeaway places within walking distance but I wouldn't really be walking round late at night. To be honest you do really need to hire a car if your coming to L.A - we did a lot of walking but its a bit of hike even to get to the main hollywood boulevard strip from the hotel. Overall for the price and helpfulness of the staff we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap for location but would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Likkysam
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights, very small room indeed but it was very cheap for 4 of us staying in a room with 2 queen beds, location is great! my only problem was the foul stench of old cigarette smoke which filled the entire room and was impossble to get rid of. overall you get what you pay for, this motel is cheap nd nothing more than i expected

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: JRK25
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel - given the price, the chain's reputation and some reviews I had read about its location I was not expecting too much but it was a decent hotel (though after having spent a few days in camp 4 in yosemite I may have just been glad of a bed!). Had a room right on the main road opposite the children's hospital but the noise from it wasn't that bad at all, the main problem was the sound of the air conditioning unit which sounded as though it was decades old - it worked though which was the main thing. The location generally was really good - could walk to downtown hollywood and right by a station on the red line. Also, about three blocks north of the hotel is a row of smart bars and restaurants that I would recommend if you want something a bit nicer than fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: daniva_rj
Reviews.Content: Bed and towels clean. Attentive staff. Walls a little dirty. There is no area to breakfast, food stays in the lobby... DidnÂ´t like the location, felt a little insecure... Very cheap, ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap (relatively), basic, functional. Don't mind the helicopters though.”
Reviews.Author: tl8153
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on 16 January for a one-night stay before going to Vegas with a colleagues' family. The check in was a breeze as we had already prepaid using hotels.com. They managed to give us all rooms on the ground floor, which was good because we had a lot of bags. During the course of check in and getting our jet-lagged selves to bed, no fewer than 3 helicopters landed and took off from the hospital opposite. Being jet-lagged, we didn't really care/mind/heard anything, but for those who aren't, you probably want to stay a bit further away. Helicopters and ambulance sirens are an integral part of staying here. The rooms were clean, all the lights worked, the cable had a good selection and the parking plentiful. The breakfast area was as crammed as mentioned in previous posts, but it's perfectly fine and there's enough food for a large group if you're an early riser. Location wise it's ok. Near enough to Hollywood's attractions, far enough for the prices to be relatively inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient because opposite is hospital...”
Reviews.Author: DoraemonCute
Reviews.Content: Convenience -I am pregnant and I was stomach painful at midnight. Appreciated that this hotel was just opposite to hospital. I just crossed a road and reached hospital. -Walking 5 minutes can arrive Vermont/ Sunset Metro subway -Very near to Hollywood Fame of Walk and Universal Studio. Take subway from hotel less than 10 minutes. Noisy -If you are light sleeper, u don't choose this hotel. At midnight, you can hear voice in main road, it quite noisy. Safety -Overall quite safe area Restaurant -Not many restaurant around, got one Wendy Restaurant near by. Hotel facilities -When you just step in, you might feel this is not a hotel, it really a budget motel. However, inside their room quite new, got dryer, TV, fridge, Microwave, iron and closet. -Receptionist guys also very friendly and helpful. -Got vending machine to purchase mineral water, soft drink and some snacks. -Breakfast are cereal, cornflakes, fruits, coffee/ tea, muffins and bagels. -Car park spacious. -Swimming pool: I don't know because I didn't use. But it seems dirty. -Housekeeping are really great enough

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: AlexCowBoy
Reviews.Content: This motel can be considered as one of the better motels. It is very conveniently located, close to LA's main attractions, and close to the metro and freeway. We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was friendly, the rates were good, and it was pretty clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok ...”
Reviews.Author: MrMister78
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights there in Hollywood and it was OK. Some ants were running on the bath floor but I don't care. Bed and room is average. The price was also OK. Internet connection was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: TravelVitamin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and basic. The manager/receptionis was at first not so friendly upon check-in but after my partner later in the evening, made some jokes when asking him querstions, finally the ice melted. He became more friendly. Probably too stress to be a one-man band answering all the calls while people checking-in at rush hours. The bath room looked like recently renovated so it's very clean. Supermarket very close by and the metro stop too. We had a very bad experience from our neighhours that were talking outside their room very loud at 2am! Breakfast basis but good enough. I would recommend people to stay at this hotel for a L.A. visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you're a light sleeper or don't like noise, give it a miss.”
Reviews.Author: Ruth_nin
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and fairly spacious. Complimentary continental breakfast was basic and provided in the reception, which proved to be a limited space for so many people. The whole thing rather reminded me of 'feeding time at the zoo'. Most staff were helpful, but not all. Vermont is a busy road and I found the noise of the traffic to be problematic. I changed rooms (to a quieter part), but this was next to the 'storeroom/boiler room' which by default was incredibly noisy. I just couldn't win. Combined with the general noise of other residents, it was a bit of a nightmare all told. I would be very reluctant to stay again, but if noise isn't an issue to you then..... Lastly only one coffee bag (?) for the coffee machine is supplied as a matter of course.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: temphier
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the safety, service and cleanliness of the hotel. Great access to local attractions and public transit. Only downside for some may be the occasional helicopter landing at one of the hospitals across the street. If you're not a light sleeper, then it shouldn't pose a problem. Small maintenance issue was dealt with swiftly. Staff was very professional and courteous. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: DuskDonLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very helpful. Even the housekeeping staff was always smiling and helpful. This place is very clean and best location with low price. It is difficult to get place like this in L.A. with budget price. I will recommend this place to my family, friends and all.

Reviews.Title: “ohhhhhhh my god! disgusting”
Reviews.Author: rkauditor
Reviews.Content: First i arrived to be met by the rudest desk clerk in history. I arrived around 4 pm and went to my room. I went to use the rest room and closed the door. When i went to leave the door handle came off and i was locked in bathroom. I had to pry door open and put door knob on myself. The remote did not work in the room. I went to the front desk and the desk clerk said he would have someone come and fix it. I waited 3 hours and still nobody came. i could not use the restroom as there was a female friend there and the door would not close u8nless i pushed it and the door know was very loose as i put it on myself without a screw driver. That night after a long day when i came back to hotel around 2am i stopped at front desk as there was no parking. the old guy behind desk was asleep on the lobby sofa. i banged on window for 10 minutes and he finally woke up and told me to park down the street. The next day i went to desk and complained about the door and remote and about 2 hours later they finally came to fix it and told them about thwe desk clerk. they laughed. i wanted to speak to manager and was told no he does not have time for me that he was doing more important things. The staff are rude the rooms are dirty and out of date. If you want a relaxing vacation or stay then do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful & Very Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: JEL59
Reviews.Content: After a long journey from the UK my friend and I (females) arrived at this hotel to be greeted by the most horrible nastiest rudest man I have ever met in my life - Hassan was his name. Even although when I booked this hotel 6 months prior to my stay & advised them of my contact number and of my 11pm arrival this made no difference, as when we arrived (at 11pm) we were told by this rude man that he had cancelled our room because he thought that we were a no show and that he didn't phone me because the hotel didn't phone international numbers - he cancelled our room at 7pm. The room was still available but would cost $150 extra for our 3 night stay on top of the money he had already charged to my credit card meant that I was paying over double the price I had orginally booked.. He told us to leave if we didn't agree to pay the new amount and didn't care that we were two females and didn't have anywhere to stay or were familiar with the area he just stood there shouting and bawling and waving his hands saying her didn't care & not his mistake. No amount of reasoning with this man was possible. I called the Travelodge Central Reservation number but to be told by the agent that he had not released the room available and could not make a reservation and advised us to take the room for the night. As we were truly exhausted and scared of what to do, where to go etc we had to agree to his terms. However the next day we spoke to the Manager and only because I had my original paperwork he agreed to the rate that I had booked. During my duration there I saw the staff being unhelpful to others too. They were all rude including the Manager. The hotel was good for transport but not a nice area to walk around. The rooms were basic, cleaned daily and had a fridge. The breakfast was quite good but had only 3 tables to sit at. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone simply because of the rude staff who don't deserve to have the custom.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: mel_nz_9
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 weeks traveling round the western states and this was our hotel in the mainland and it was the worst hotel of the whole trip and this was due to the service. The room was good for the price and it suited our needs, easy to drive everywhere we wanted. Cleaner tried to come in once when I said no but I managed to stop her, the following day she walked in after I had yelled no thanks about 3 times and I ended up meeting her at the door yelling no but I think she still saw my husband naked. The receptionist when we arrived was nice but a different receptionist was on duty when we left and he was very rude. I tried to complain as he made a "wakeup call" to us, at 7am in the morning on a saturday which we hadnt requested. He didnt care and was rude about it and said it didnt matter. This was on top of the cleaner, so when we asked to speak to the manager he became very rude, to the point that i was crying and threatened us with the police if we didnt leave. The noise from the road outside and the medic helicopters were to be expected once you realised that there were 2 hospitals across the road, which we didnt realise when we checked in, and it was a main road (we knew this tho). We wouldnt stay here again and wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Economic & Great”
Reviews.Author: Varma72
Reviews.Content: Being a budget chain of hotels, we were apprehensive on the quality & cleanliness of the rooms. But we were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the rooms. It is a great hotel with basic amenities. Perfect for the tourist traveller. Very homely service, made us feel very comfortable. Very close to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel for explore L.A”
Reviews.Author: Vendy_St
Reviews.Content: This was a first motel at our three weeks journey through USA. We have stayed there three nights and location it was very good near metro station and bus station. From here we found a bus to Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills and metro line to Universal studios and Long Beach. Just 200 m away is big supermarket with wide range of food and drinks. Room was very clean with comfort bed, litlle fridge, coffe maker and microwave which was very helpful. Parking is very spacious and you feel secure at this area.

Reviews.Title: “sirens, sirens, sirens”
Reviews.Author: cruiseshipnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the start of our family hoilday. The hotel was awesome. Very clean. The only thing that was a royal pain was the medic choppers landing on the roof of the hospital across the street. Then all the ambulances and fire dept vehicles felt the need to run the sirens in the middle of the night...Lack of sleep ...oh yes. However we would stay there again as it was very close to the metro (underground) . We travelled to universal for $1.25, went to long beach for $1.55. Very safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “PSP went missing from our room”
Reviews.Author: MasonsGrandma
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when my grandson's PSP came up missing from my room when we went to the beach. I contacted the manager and he talked to the staff and said that they didn't have it and that was all he would do. Corporate gave me a claim number but said its franchised so they don't stand behind the individual hotels. I would not stay at this Travel Lodge again.

Reviews.Title: “no breakfast!?”
Reviews.Author: bob-bob-bob13
Reviews.Content: The room is fine, but the biggest problem is that there's no breakfast!!! this is horrible! I was told at night when I checked-it that there's a breakfast, but then I came to the reception in the morning, and they showed me a few rolls with a cup of coffee, on a stand next to the reception, and told this is the breakfast! This was really horrible to find out.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TheJazzyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights as we wanted a convenient motel with free parking that was easily accessible to Universal Studios and Six Flags. The entire motel is old and a bit run down, but the room was basic and clean. The unfortunate thing was the very strong smell of cleaning products (bleach??) that permeated throughout the room for our entire stay. Aside from the strong smell, the stay was fine. Basic toiletries are provided. The free parking was a great bonus, along with the free wireless, very basic breakfast (muffins and coffee) and closeness to the metro (only a 100+ metres down the road to the closest metro stop). Once you get to the metro, it's only a few stops to Hollywood Boulevard and Universal Studios (much cheaper to take the metro than to park at either of those locations!). Great spot if you're looking for a cheap but clean budget motel.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Allergictraveller
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay for 2 weeks in LA near the Hospital. I was worried about staying in this low bugdet place, but was pleasantly suprised. The room was much nicer and newer than I expected. It is still low budget, don't get me wrong but I didn't feel the need to run away. My room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom acceptable. The area around the hotel is safe but not very nice. Up Vermont street there is actually a pretty nice small stretch of restaurants with outside seating. There are 2 grocery stores within 1 block (the room has a microwave and fridge) and there is a coin operated washer/dryer on the premise. The hotel is quite far from Hollywood (not walking distance) but with care or metro (1 block away) it really is not a big problem. Needs for improvement are the friendly but rather unhelpful staff, the dirty pool furniture (haven't seen anyone clean it in 2 weeks) and noisy rooms. The walls never completely shut out the traffic noise from busy sunset drive, and although I never noticed most of my neighbors I was unluckly to have to hear love making or heated discussions once in a while (especailly the weekend when the place is packed).

Reviews.Title: “Older, but clean. a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: menolyfair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to Hollywood, the beaches, Burbank and easy to get to a Dodgers game. The property is old, but the rooms are clean and they had good customer service. There was a Vons was right around the corner so we were able to put juice and drinks in the fridge. The unit A/C blew right on one of the beds, but otherwise this basic hotel room was perfect for our needs. A place to sleep while we were being typical Hollywood and Los Angeles tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but fine”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler2
Reviews.Content: This is a standard motel, nothing more, but nothing less. Room was clean, good sized, parking adequate, typical motel breakfast. Very close to Metro and bus lines. Staff friendly. If all you need is a decent place to sleep in this part of LA, this motel does the job just fine, and at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the cost”
Reviews.Author: glyneth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days when we arrived in LA. Good location next to the metro line, 3 stops to Hollywood Bvld, plus easy to get to from the highway. The staff were nice enough and the room was decent for the price, although strangely sticky carpet but otherwise clean. Would recommend for anyone looking for a good hotel around 100 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Margaret W
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights here. Our unit was basic but clean and had all we required. Air conditioner was a bit noisey (as most are). Staff were very helpful and polite. Access to metro was about 200 -300 metres away and the ideal way to travel to Universal Studios and Hollywood Boulevard. Price at $75 per night was very competitive which included a simple continental breakfast. Overall, ideal place for the things we did.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, basic sleeping place”
Reviews.Author: Exode
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Travelodge from arriving from Lax late at night. There was just enough room for our car but they have an additional parking lot within walking distance. The room was basic but clean. Everything you need was there. The neighbourhood was nothing special, there is a good thai restaurant next to the hotel. It took us a one hour walk to Sunset Strip but with the metro it only took 5 minutes. Breakfast contains of muffins and muffins, nothing fancy but ok. Overall ok, just a basic sleeping place.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a luxury hotel - but the beds were clean”
Reviews.Author: kcp5
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Travelodge Hollywood before heading down to San Diego. I knew going in that this was not a 4 star hotel. The biggest "pro" was that the beds were clean and comfortable. Basically that is most important to me. Like others have posted, the carpets need a really really good cleaning or better yet, replace them. The place comes across as old, kind of run down but for under $100 for a night, what can you expect? There was just a shower stall in the bathroom which "looked" clean - reminded me of a swim-club shower actually. When we first arrived I was taken back by the sign posted on the building stating something to the effect that the state of CA has them inform you that the building is made of materials that may be hazardous to your health and can cause birth defects. I've never seen that posted on a building before - maybe it's just a CA law (who knows how many buildings have asbestos or other things elsewhere??). I just found it unnerving. There was a run-down restaurant (closed??) next door with lots and lots of flies buzzing around. We didn't have time for the pool so I can't comment on it but from a distance it looked clean. Breakfast was "grab and go" which is fine - Otis Spunkmeyer (sp?) muffins and danish and coffee and juice. The coffee only had powder creamer (I'll admit, I'm picky and like a liquid creamer) but again, for under $100 I really have no right to complain. The hotel served the purpose we needed and was budget friendly. I would not want to spend more than one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Staying near Hollywood Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: quindecim
Reviews.Content: We booked Travelodge Hollywood-Vermont/Sunset due to its close proximity to Hollywood Boulevard. The room was pretty average but at US$85.50 per night we couldn't expect more. The room was pretty comfortable for two and parking was easily available upfront. However, the sound insulation was really bad. We could hear people talking at night along the corridors and the sound of police sirens in the middle of the night. The free breakfast was adequate for a morning fill but not enough if you like having a heavy breakfast. The motel is recommended if you're looking for a no-frills accomodation that is near to the attractions in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: traveluva
Reviews.Content: I booked this for the first three nights of my stay in LA before moving downtown. I was under the impression that it was closer to the main points of interest in Hollywood and while it is two blocks from Hollywood Blvd. it is another 15 - 20 mins walk to the Chinese Theatre / Kodak theatre etc. but is is so close to the metro station and from there you can go anywhere in Los Angeles.
