The metro itself doesnt go to many places but it does connect you to a fairly decent bus service which does. Also it is close to the stop where the Griffith Observatory weekend dash stops so that was great. The hotel is fine... it was clean and toiletries were provided. Breakfast can be gotten at the main reception and consists of coffee, orange juice, muffins/pastries and some fruit. It wouldnt fill you for the day but it would keep you going for a while. Overall it was fine... dont expect it to be overly luxurious but it is a good enough base if you dont mind commuting or being a bit away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, right near the metro”
Reviews.Author: La_dolce_vita83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here after a lengthy bus ride from santa monica to the metro. This hotel was in sight the moment we got off the train so we dicided to check it out. For what we paid (85$USD) the rooms were very clean, the beds were firm and comfortable and the general feel to the room was pleasant. It was so enjoyable we decided to stay an extra night and see all the sights we might have missed the first night. The location of the hotel (Sunset/Vermont) was a very safe neighbourhood. The local's were very friendly to us and it was far enough away from the seedyness and wierdness of central hollywood. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and plan to stay here again in october.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: atlohi
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge has absolutely the best location if you need to be close to someone who is in one of the three hospitals that are within walking distance. We stayed there for four days and had a clean room room with a comfortable bed. We had no problems with the neighborhood, although we were not walking around late at night. The front desk people were courteous and efficient. They were very helpful when we had to change our reservation. I would go back to this hotel again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Roberval
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. A two-minute walk from the hotel to the subway station. Right in the middle of Sunset Boulevard and Santa Monica Boulevard. Easy access to buses for Sunset STrip or Venice Beach. One of the receptionist was very helpful....Ask for andy. Kept our luggage in the maintenace room without charging us a penny. Room was clean. Nothing luxirious but if you're looking for cheap but clean accommadion, that's it. The only negative point is breakfast. It was really basis. Juice was sugar and water. Coffee without milk but with creamer but there were bananas and apple.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing the sights”
Reviews.Author: SB30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year and it was in a really good location. We bartered with the reception to get a good price which they gave us and they also provided us with a lot of good information on where to go and what to see. From this hotel on the Sunset strip you could walk a few blocks to Hollywood Boulevard, which has some great shops and a view of the Holly wood sign. It is probably best to have a car but as we did not we caught the bus to a fantastic shopping centre called Glendale.We also caught the bus from outside the hotel to a comedy club along the strip and also to Rodeo Drive, although we did have to walk to get to the actual road. The room was quite small but very comfy and it felt safe and secure. The reception also arranged our transfers for us to get back to the airport. I would definately recommend staying here for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “More than did the job...”
Reviews.Author: Winter_Log_Fires
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel a "4". Not because it blew me away with it's egyptian sheets or Bose stereo - but because it is a 4 in it's category. It was more than adequate. Good sized room and bed. Clean, good location (just round the corner from the Scientology place if that's of interest). Metro 2 minutes walk - this can take you to the Hollywood sites - kodak theatre, street with the stars etc). Quite location too - set back from road. There is a swimming pool - though not very private - all the rooms look over it and it's in front of the hotel in the middle of the car park. Still nice idea. Parking right near rooms. Didn't have time to explore the local area/restauramts. We did have a car and used it to find restaurants (The Standard in the financial district is worth a look) so apart from the metro, can't really comment on the local area and self sufficiency without travel. Hotel had it's own fridge and microwave. The hotel did provide a breakfast though this is essentially a pastry and some coffee. We went to a market /juice bar about 5 minutes walk (turn left out of hotel, straight over the cross roads - juice bar on right and market further up on left). I would say "easy to find" but can't really comment. We took our Navman and didn't work out soon enough that North Vermont is N Vermont.... I suspect it is very easy to find if you're in a taxi and/or remember this advice for your sat nav... :)

Reviews.Title: “It's Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kjh61
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge was OK. The room was clean, the bed was comfy but didn't have enough pillows. The pool area was filthy, with a dirty band aid near the table we sat at and the ground was so dirty it turned our feet black. Also the pool area is very cramped with lounge chairs & tables only fitting at the deep end and the lounge chairs were filthy, covered with dirt. The first floor rooms are noisy, every step and movement from above is heard, and the maids are quite noisy too, beginning their vacuuming right above us around 9am! They have wireless internet, which is definately a plus! The location irritated me because it really is far from everything that's "fun" on the strip... it's a good 15 minute ride on Sunset to get to the main entertainment section. The surrounding area didn't seem too safe. We didn't feel comfortable walking around after dark, which really preseted a problem when we arrived back at the hotel after a movie at 10 pm only to find there was absolutely NO parking spots! We ended up parking in a spot near the pool that said No Parking and nothing was said. All together, the Travelodge was a great value for the money but I would probably shell out the extra money for a higher quality hotel that's closer to everything next time.
